ended.note: Died at post on or before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 12, 1864, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on Febraury 21, 1867, after confirmation.
Commission (issued during recess of the Senate) not of record; enclosed with an instruction of July 19, 1881. Recommissioned on October 26, 1881, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 13, 1886, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.

ended.note: Probably presented recall on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1915, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1927, after confirmation.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 2, 1949, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 18, 1965, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 8, 1973, after confirmation.
Arrived at post on June 28, 1990. Had not presented credentials before the overthrow of the Government of Liberia on September 11, 1990.
Not commissioned; nomination not confirmed by the Senate.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 16, 1930, after confirmation. Did not proceed to post in this capacity.
Took oath of office and proceeded to post, but did not present credentials. The Government of Liberia requested his recall on February 11, 1933; Mitchell left post on March 22, 1933.
